sen.j: 今出川通（いまでがわどおり）は京都市中心市街地北部の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Imadegawa-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Imadegawa-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Imadegawa-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in the northern part of downtown Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 京都市中心市街地北部 を the northern part of the downtown Kyoto City としました。

sen.j: 東は左京区銀閣寺町の慈照寺門前から西は京福電気鉄道等持院駅のやや西まで延びている。
sen.e: It starts from the gate of Jisho-ji (Ginkaku-ji) Temple, Ginkakujicho, Sakyo Ward in the east and ends around a liittle west of Tojin Station, Keifuku Electric Railroad
It starts from the gate of Jisho-ji (Ginkaku-ji) Temple (Ginkakujicho, Sakyo ward) in the east and ends slightly west of Tojin Station, (Keifuku Electric Railroad).
It starts from the gate of Jisho-ji (Ginkaku-ji) Temple (Ginkakuji-cho, Sakyo Ward) in the east, and ends slightly west of Tojiin Station of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

sen.j: 鴨川 (淀川水系)から東は東今出川通とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: The eastern section of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) may be called Higashi-Imadegawa-dori Street.
The eastern section of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System) can be called Higashi-Imadegawa-dori Street.
The section east of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) can be called Higashi-Imadegawa-dori Street.

sen.j: 京都御苑の北端を通る。
sen.e: It runs along the northern edge of Kyoto Gyoen.
It runs along the northern edge of Kyoto Gyoen.
It runs along the northern edge of Kyoto Gyoen National Garden.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Gyoen National Garden としました（京都御苑のウェブサイトより）。

sen.j: 平安京の範囲からは北に外れているが、後に市街地が北東へ拡大したことにより通りが作られた。
sen.e: The street was outside Heiankyo, but it was developed later with the expansion of the downtown area to the northeast.
The street was outside Heiankyo, but it was developed later with the expansion of the downtown area to the northeast.
The street was outside Heian-kyo, but it was developed later with the expansion of the downtown area to the northeast.

sen.j: 当初は北小路とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Its was originally named Kitakoji-dori Street.
Its was originally called Kitakoji-dori Street.
Its was originally called Kitakoji-dori Street.

sen.j: 「今出川」の名前は鴨川分流の今出川が東洞院通から東京極大路（現在の寺町通）まで通りに沿って流れていたことに由来する。
sen.e: The name “Imaide-gawa” originates from one of the tributary of the Kmogawa River called Imaide-gawa River that runs from the Higashi-no-Toin-dori Street to the Higasikyogoku-oji Street (present-day Teramachi-dori Street).

The name “Imaide-gawa” originates from a tributary of the Kamogawa River called the Imaide-gawa River, which runs from Higashi-no-Toin-dori Street to Higasikyogoku-oji Street (the present-day Teramachi-dori Street).

The name 'Imade-gawa' originates from a tributary of the Kamo-gawa River called the Imade-gawa River, which ran from Higashi-no-Toin-dori Street to Higashikyogoku-oji Street (the present-day Teramachi-dori Street).

sen.j: 1976年まで京都市電今出川線が白川通（銀閣寺道電停）から西大路通（北野白梅町駅電停）まで通っていた。
sen.e: The Imadegawa Line, Kyoto City Tram once ran until 1976 from the Shirakawa-dori Street (Ginkakuji-michi Stop) to the Nishioji-dori Street (Kitano-Hakubaicho Station).
The Imadegawa Line (Kyoto City Tram) once ran until 1976 from Shirakawa-dori Street (Ginkakuji-michi Stop) to Nishioji-dori Street (Kitano-Hakubaicho Station).
The Imadegawa Line of the Kyoto City Trams ran until 1976 from Shirakawa-dori Street (Ginkakuji-michi Stop) to Nishioji-dori Street (Kitano-Hakubaicho Stop).

sen.j: 西は北野白梅町交差点までが京都府道101号銀閣寺宇多野線となっている。
sen.e: In the west, the street up tol the Kitano-Hakubaicho crossing belongs to Ginkakuji-Uchino-sen, Kyoto Fudo 101 Go (Kyoto Prefectural Road 101).
In the west, the street up to the Kitano-Hakubaicho crossing belongs to Ginkakuji-Uchino-sen, Kyoto Fudo 101 Go (Kyoto Prefectural Road 101).
In the west, the street up to the Kitano-Hakubaicho crossing belongs to the Ginkakuji-Utano Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route 101.
sen.cmt: Ginkakuji-Uchino Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 101としました（既出記事と統一）。

sen.j: 上側が東側、下側が西側。
sen.e: East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper and west is lower.

sen.j: 左側が北側、右側が南側。
sen.e: North is left and south is right.
North is left and south is right.
North is left and south is right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
